text.0: A viral meme claims that inhaling gas prevents dementia. Is this true? Here are the facts: https://t.co/iekOYASNWD #DubawaChecks
text.1: Twitter has introduced a new feature that urges users to read news articles before retweeting it. This is in a bid to fight misinformation by keeping users duly informed. How will this help in fighting fake news in Nigeria? Read on for more: https://t.co/UskKyXBHSA #DubawaChecks
text.2:
Have you ever been contacted to provide sensitive information such as your banking details and passwords? This is known as phishing, or as it is popularly called in Nigeria "yahoo yahoo". Here are ways to protect yourselves from such attacks: #DubawaChecks
https://t.co/KIO02fL6AI
text.3: A certain website claims the Federal Government of Nigeria is recruiting and employing 50,000 youths via a link it provided. This is false. The website has been uncovered to be a phishing website used for fraudulent activities. Read here: https://t.co/04QUd3jDw7 #DubawaChecks
text.4: Farooq Kperogi claimed in a tweet that Nigeria is the global capital of poverty and the second most terrorised country in the world. However, data from relevant bodies have proven these claims to be false and misleading. Read here: https://t.co/DmzZKr4FwC #DubawaChecks
